snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said he was forced to order the vote, arguing that his coalition partners proved it would be impossible to pass a budget with deep cuts.
abstract: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu calls for elections early in 2013 instead of October 2013, as scheduled, saying budget cuts require going to elections as quickly as possible; victory around same time that the United States is either inaugurating a new president or starting a second Obama term would probably embolden the prime minister, allowing him to continue his aggressive approach toward Iran, while mostly ignoring the Palestinian conflict.

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner and Gabby Soleman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said he was forced to order the vote, arguing that his coalition partners proved it would be impossible to pass a budget with deep cuts.

headline.seo: Netanyahu Calls for Early Elections in Israel
headline.main: Netanyahu Calls for Early Elections in Israel
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Announces Earlier Vote In Israel
